page.title: 02Westbury-on-Severn Village
page.content: In the centre of Westbury village, stands the centuries old Preaching Cross, the Doctor's surgery and the Red Lion public house supplying all from morning coffee to evening pints. Down the lane facing the cottages is the main entrance to the church of St Mary, Peter & Paul. By its side is the separate wooden shingle tiled steeple of the bell tower with its eight bells and golden weather vane. The small churchyard, now almost full, has a Burial Ground nearby. In a niche in the churchyard wall is a War Memorial to the dead of two world wars. Two kissing gates at the end of the wall lead to another church entrance & the side of Westbury Court Home for the Elderly & eventually to the entrance of Westbury Court Garden a water garden laid out in the Dutch manner of 1700, quite unique.
